intro: Blaeria glabella, commonly known as the smooth bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its simple, branching stems and small, rounded leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle. The plant is a carnivorous species, capable of trapping and digesting small aquatic organisms. It thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, typically in nutrient-poor conditions. Its flowers are small and usually pale in color, with distinctive spurred petals that aid in pollination.
